Just as a man takes old clothes and wore new ones, he leaves his body and puts away his old bodies.

This unmanifest, unchanging, unchanging and unchanging person should not regret this. .
O mighty-armed one, you should think that he is eternally born or eternally dead, yet you should not grieve for him. .
Death is certain for one who is born and that one who is dead is certainly dead.
O descendant of Bharata, what is the regret for the unmanifest, the unmanifest, the unmanifest deaths? .
Someone else sees him as a wonder and speaks astonishingly in the same way while another hears him as a wonder and no one knows it even after hearing it .
O descendant of Bharata, the embodied soul is always invincible to the body. Therefore, O descendant of Bharata, you should not grieve for all living beings. .

The Supreme Personality of Godhead said: When the Supreme Personality of Godhead, O son of the earth, is satisfied with the self, the mind is satisfied with the self-realized soul. .

One who is freed from attachment and hatred, moves about in sense gratification, attains the mercy of the Supreme Personality of Godhead.
When the mind is merciful to all sufferings, the intelligence of a person with a happy mind is relieved. .
There is no intelligence for the steadfast nor for the steadfast and the mind is not meditated upon by the peaceful one who is unsettled .
When the mind is moving about in the senses, the mind takes away the intelligence of the living entity, just as the wind takes away his intelligence in the water. .
Therefore, O mighty-armed one, whose intelligence is established in all respects, the senses, the senses and the objects of the senses are established.
The night in which all living entities are awake is the self-realized soul in which all living beings are awake and that night is the night of the sage. .

Just as the waters of the ocean enter into the unchanging state of being filled with the unchanging state of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, they enter into the state of peace, but they are all peaceful, not the lustful one.
A man who gives up all his desires moves about and moves about without desire and who is free from egoism and who is free from egoism attains peace
